config.text: DISCOVER NEW YORK LANDMARKS

West from Bryant Park, 42nd Street meets Broadway at Times Square, the center of the theater district, where the pulsating neon suggests a heart for the city itself. Since the major cleanup launched by the city and by business interests like Disney, the ambience here has changed dramatically.

The exteriors of individual structures, ranging from farmhouses to skyscrapers. Examples include the Woolworth Building, the Pieter Claesen Wyckoff House in Brooklyn, and the Cyclone roller coaster in Coney Island.
